0: UPDATE: 12:32 p.m.: The man accused of killing a Gwinnett police officer was found hiding in a wooden shed wielding a lawn mower blade and was shot and killed after he refused to obey police commands, authorities said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR After receiving information from a tipster on Tafahree Maynard’s whereabouts, 75-90 police officers descended on a neighborhood in unincorporated Snellville, set up a perimeter and went house to house, Gwinnett Police Chief Butch Ayers said at a press briefing. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR After finding Maynard, police initially used a Taser. They shot after determining he had was armed with a mower blade. Police said the officers were five to six feet away from Maynard when he was shot. “The danger to the community is over,” Ayers said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Maynard was found about one mile from where Gwinnett County police Officer Antwan Toney was shot Saturday afternoon. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR UPDATE 11:29 a.m.﻿: Tafahree Maynard, the man accused of shooting and killing a Gwinnett County police officer Saturday, is dead, officials told Channel 2 Action News. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Sources say man accused of killing Gwinnett Police Officer Antwan Toney is dead . pic.twitter.com/eI1kbiP6jI — Tony Thomas (@TonyThomasWSB) October 22, 2018 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR UPDATE 11:22 a.m.: A media briefing previously scheduled for 11:30 a.m. at the South Precinct has been delayed. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Gwinnett County officer Antwan Toney was killed in the line of duty Saturday, Oct. 21 2018. (Gwinnett County Police) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR UPDATE 11:13 a.m.﻿: A man accused of shooting and killing a Gwinnett County police officer Saturday has been located, officials told Channel 2 Action News. Tafahree Maynard’s condition is unknown. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Breaking: sources say accused shooter Tafahree Maynard has been located by police neas Snellville . Condition Unknown. Shots fired . @wsbtv pic.twitter.com/0vGz4AozMr — Tony Thomas (@TonyThomasWSB) October 22, 2018 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR There is a huge police presence on Hewatt Road in Snellville, the news station reported. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR BREAKING: the scene from the search for the suspect wanted in murder of #AntwanToney @wsbtv pic.twitter.com/11e5ofd3fy — Audrey Washington (@AudreyWSBTV) October 22, 2018 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR ORIGINAL STORY: The search for a man accused of shooting and killing a Gwinnett police officer entered its third day Monday as officers canvassed the area near his mother’s home. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Just before 9 a.m., Gwinnett police said there was a “credible sighting” of 18-year-old Tafahree Maynard in the Snellville area in the last 12 hours. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR There has been a credible sighting of Tafahree Maynard in the Snellville area in the last 12 hours. Keep an eye out and call 911 if you see him. Maynard is 6’01” and 300lbs. pic.twitter.com/XwSfRBIiPX — Gwinnett Police Dept (@GwinnettPd) October 22, 2018 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR SWAT crews were seen on Cordite Loop in Snellville, which is near where members of Maynard’s family live, Gwinnett County police Sgt. Jake Smith told reporters Monday morning. Officials think he is in that area. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A SWAT team was on Cordite Loop in Snellville Monday morning. JOHN SPINK / JSPINK@AJC.COM NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police believe Maynard fired the shot that killed 30-year-old Gwinnett County police Officer Antwan Toney on Saturday afternoon. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “We are kind of taking away his resources as much as we can,” Smith said of Maynard, who last attended Shiloh High School in February 2017. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR RELATED: Search continues for man accused of fatally shooting Gwinnett officer NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR MORE: Gwinnett officer’s colleagues mourn as manhunt for suspect continues NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR There is a “good chance” that police are able to find Maynard alive, Smith said. When Maynard was seen, he was in “relatively good health,” though he might have an injury to his hand, Smith said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Anyone who sees Maynard should call 911 and not approach him, police said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Watch: UPDATE - Manhunt continues for teen accused of fatally shooting #Gwinnett officer - https://t.co/dWuvCS4vab pic.twitter.com/ZjQwt6Kj4r — John Spink (@johnjspink) October 22, 2018 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Another suspect, Isaiah Pretlow, 19, of Snellville, was arrested late Saturday night by U.S. marshals and charged with aggravated assault. He was booked at the Gwinnett County Detention Center shortly before 6:30 a.m. Sunday, and is being held without bond, according to jail records. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He and Maynard were together when Toney was called to investigate a “suspicious vehicle” near Shiloh Middle School in unincorporated Snellville, according to police. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Toney was shot while approaching the car, officials said. He was taken to Gwinnett Medical Center, where he was pronounced dead. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Toney, the fourth Georgia officer killed by gunfire this year and 45th nationwide, was just days away from his three-year anniversary on the police force when he was killed. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Visitation has been scheduled for 2 p.m and 6 p.m. Tuesday at Crowell Brothers Funeral Home, 5051
